txt.en: 'You certainly saved me from death. I thank you stranger and will heed your advice and flee to Ethring.'
'I did not think the fighting would come this far inland. I thank you for saving me and shall leave for Ethring immediately.'
Erchar can be found at his encampment in the western end of Dor-en-Ernil, south-west of Tungobel.\n\nYou should speak with Erchar.
'Those cursed corsairs came out of nowhere! I'll gladly head north to Ethring if it means safety in these dark times.'
Speak with Erchar and inform him of your success
'You sent the survivors to Ethring? Good work. I'm sure they will find temporary shelter there from the Corsair threat.'
The townsperson thanks you and flees to Ethring
Erchar informs you of a hamlet to the north that may be under siege. He has asked you to rescue any survivors.

'Not an hour ago, a band of Corsairs travelled past this camp-site. As luck would have it, we remained undetected.\n\n'The enemy band was heading north-east towards Tungobel, a small hamlet. If it is not too late for the village, perhaps you would be able to rescue any townsfolk from a certain death. These people are wood cutters and fishermen, they are not warriors.'
The hamlet of Tungobel can be found north-east of Erchar's encampment.\n\nRescue the townsfolk from the Corsair and Haradrim forces.
